content: Career General Asked by AnonymousAsked on 04 Jul 2019Am I allowed to reject job offer after signing it? If you signed a job offer today and let's say 1 week later you get a much better offer. Can reject the signed one and take up the new one?3 answersAnswerBump0

Elijah Lee, Independent Financial Advisor at Phillip Securities (Jurong East Lite)Top Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomUpdated on 04 Jul 2019Yes you can. However some job contracts may impose a penalty (most often financial) if you sign on the dotted line and eventually choose not to commence. Read the contract carefully before signing.2 comments3
Question Poster04 Jul 2019Hmm even if one has not started first day of work?Elijah Lee04 Jul 2019Yes. It's possible

Tons of examples online (Google is our best friend). As mentioned by others, always check if there is penalty, or if the penalty is worth paying for the better job offer. All the best!0 comments0
